# Xquik

> X (Twitter) real-time data platform. Real-time account monitoring, data extraction, giveaway draws, and a developer API with REST endpoints, HMAC webhooks, and an MCP server for AI agents.

Xquik tracks tweets, quotes, replies, retweets, and follower changes from monitored X accounts and delivers events via REST API polling, HMAC-signed webhooks, or an MCP server (Model Context Protocol) for AI agent integration. The platform provides 19 extraction tools for pulling replies, reposts, quotes, followers, following, verified followers, community members, community moderators, community posts, community search, list members, list posts, list followers, mentions, posts, threads, articles, Space participants, and people search results from any public account, tweet, list, community, or Space. It also offers giveaway draws with configurable filters and X data lookups (tweets, users, follower checks).

Authentication: API key passed via the `x-api-key` header. Key format: `xq_` + 64 hex characters. Base URL: `https://xquik.com/api/v1`. MCP server: `https://xquik.com:3100/mcp` (StreamableHTTP transport, same API key auth). Event types: `tweet.new`, `tweet.quote`, `tweet.reply`, `tweet.retweet`, `follower.gained`, `follower.lost`. Rate limits: 10 req/s sustained with 20 burst for API endpoints.

## Docs

- [Introduction](https://docs.xquik.com/introduction): Platform overview, capabilities, and integration methods.
- [Quickstart](https://docs.xquik.com/quickstart): Get your API key and make your first request in 2 minutes.
- [API Overview](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/overview): REST API v1 base URL, authentication, rate limits, and conventions.
- [Authentication](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/authentication): API key format, dual auth endpoints, key management, and security best practices.

## API Reference - Account & Keys

- [Get Account](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/account/get): Retrieve account info, subscription status, and current period usage.
- [Update Account](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/account/update): Update account locale preference (session auth only).
- [Create API Key](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/api-keys/create): Generate a new API key for programmatic access (session auth only).
- [List API Keys](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/api-keys/list): Retrieve all API keys with status and usage timestamps (session auth only).
- [Revoke API Key](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/api-keys/revoke): Permanently deactivate an API key. Immediate and irreversible.

## API Reference - Monitors

- [Create Monitor](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/monitors/create): Start monitoring an X account for real-time tweet events.
- [List Monitors](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/monitors/list): Retrieve all monitors for your account.
- [Get Monitor](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/monitors/get): Retrieve details for a specific monitor by ID.
- [Update Monitor](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/monitors/update): Change event types or toggle active status for a monitor.
- [Delete Monitor](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/monitors/delete): Remove a monitor and stop tracking the X account.

## API Reference - Events

- [List Events](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/events/list): Query events from monitored accounts with filtering and cursor-based pagination.
- [Get Event](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/events/get): Retrieve a single event by ID with full details.

## API Reference - Webhooks

- [Create Webhook](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/webhooks/create): Register an HTTPS endpoint to receive real-time event notifications.
- [List Webhooks](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/webhooks/list): Retrieve all webhook endpoints registered to your account.
- [Update Webhook](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/webhooks/update): Update the URL, event types, or active state of an existing webhook.
- [Delete Webhook](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/webhooks/delete): Permanently remove a webhook endpoint and stop all future deliveries.
- [List Deliveries](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/webhooks/deliveries): View delivery attempts and their statuses for a specific webhook.

## API Reference - Draws

- [Create Draw](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/draws/create): Execute a giveaway draw on a tweet to select random winners.
- [List Draws](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/draws/list): Retrieve draw history with cursor-based pagination.
- [Get Draw](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/draws/get): Retrieve draw details including winners and tweet metadata.
- [Export Draw](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/draws/export): Export draw data as CSV, XLSX, or Markdown.

## API Reference - Extractions

- [Create Extraction](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/extractions/create): Run an extraction job using one of 19 tools (reply, repost, quote, follower, following, verified follower, community, community moderator, community post, community search, list member, list post, list follower, mention, people search, post, thread, article, Space).
- [List Extractions](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/extractions/list): Retrieve extraction job history with filtering and cursor-based pagination.
- [Get Extraction](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/extractions/get): Retrieve extraction job details with paginated results.
- [Export Extraction](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/extractions/export): Export extraction results as CSV, XLSX, or Markdown. 50,000 row limit.
- [Estimate Extraction](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/extractions/estimate): Get a cost estimate before running an extraction job.

## API Reference - X API

- [Get Tweet](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/x/get-tweet): Look up a single tweet with author information. Metered.
- [Search Tweets](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/x/search-tweets): Search tweets by query string. Metered.
- [Get User](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/x/get-user): Look up an X user profile by username. Metered.
- [Check Follower](https://docs.xquik.com/api-reference/x/check-follower): Check follow relationship between two X users. Metered.

## Webhooks

- [Webhooks Overview](https://docs.xquik.com/webhooks/overview): Real-time event delivery to your HTTPS endpoints with HMAC-SHA256 signatures.
- [Signature Verification](https://docs.xquik.com/webhooks/verification): Verify HMAC-SHA256 signatures on incoming webhook deliveries.

## MCP Server

- [MCP Server Overview](https://docs.xquik.com/mcp/overview): Connect AI agents and IDEs (Claude Desktop, Claude Code, ChatGPT, Codex CLI, Cursor, VS Code, Windsurf, OpenCode) to Xquik via Model Context Protocol.
- [MCP Tools Reference](https://docs.xquik.com/mcp/tools): All 20 MCP tools with input/output schemas and usage examples.

## Guides

- [Workflows](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/workflows): End-to-end integration patterns with complete code examples.
- [Error Handling](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/error-handling): Error recovery patterns, retry strategies, and rate limit handling.
- [Rate Limits](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/rate-limits): Rate limit tiers, burst allowances, and client-side rate limiting.
- [Webhook Testing](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/webhook-testing): Test webhook integrations locally with ngrok, RequestBin, and CLI tools.
- [Billing & Usage](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/billing): Subscription pricing, usage quotas, and monthly operation limits.

## Optional

- [Troubleshooting](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/troubleshooting): Common issues and solutions for the Xquik API.
- [Type Definitions](https://docs.xquik.com/guides/types): TypeScript type definitions for all API request and response objects.

## Build With Xquik

Business models, app ideas, and products you can build on the Xquik API. Each idea lists the primary Xquik features it uses.

### Analytics & Intelligence

- **X audience analyzer**: Break down any account's followers by verification status, follower count tiers, and activity. Uses: follower_explorer, verified_follower_explorer, get-user-info.
- **Engagement rate dashboard**: Track likes, retweets, replies, and quotes per post over time for any account. Uses: post_extractor, lookup-tweet.
- **Competitor benchmarking tool**: Compare engagement metrics, posting frequency, and follower growth across competing accounts side by side. Uses: post_extractor, follower_explorer, monitors, events.
- **Trend detection engine**: Search tweets by keyword on a schedule, score velocity of emerging topics, and alert when trends spike. Uses: search-tweets, webhooks.
- **Influencer scoring platform**: Rate influencers by follower quality (verified ratio, engagement rate, audience overlap). Uses: follower_explorer, verified_follower_explorer, post_extractor.
- **Sentiment analysis service**: Monitor an account's mentions, run NLP on reply text, and produce sentiment scores over time. Uses: mention_extractor, reply_extractor.
- **Brand health monitor**: Track mentions, replies, and quote tweets about a brand and alert on negative sentiment spikes. Uses: monitors (tweet.quote, tweet.reply), mention_extractor, webhooks.
- **Share of voice tracker**: Compare how often competing brands are mentioned in a niche using periodic keyword searches. Uses: search-tweets.
- **Viral content detector**: Scan tweets by keyword, flag posts exceeding engagement velocity thresholds, and notify in real time. Uses: search-tweets, lookup-tweet, webhooks.
- **Audience overlap finder**: Extract followers of two accounts and compute the intersection to find shared audiences. Uses: follower_explorer.

### Growth & Marketing

- **Follower growth tracker app**: Monitor follower.gained and follower.lost events, chart net growth over time, and send daily digests. Uses: monitors (follower.gained, follower.lost), events, webhooks.
- **Optimal posting time finder**: Analyze an account's post history and engagement patterns to recommend the best times to tweet. Uses: post_extractor, lookup-tweet.
- **Hashtag performance analytics**: Search tweets by hashtag, aggregate engagement metrics, and rank hashtags by ROI. Uses: search-tweets, lookup-tweet.
- **Lead generation from tweet replies**: Extract reply authors from high-intent tweets (e.g., "looking for a tool"), enrich with profile data, and export as leads. Uses: reply_extractor, get-user-info.
- **Social CRM enrichment**: Look up X profiles for CRM contacts, append follower count, bio, and verification status. Uses: get-user-info, check-follow.
- **Campaign attribution tracker**: Monitor a campaign hashtag, extract all participants, and measure reach by summing follower counts. Uses: search-tweets, reply_extractor, get-user-info.
- **Drip follow checker**: After an outreach campaign, periodically check if target accounts followed back. Uses: check-follow.
- **Audience builder**: Extract followers of niche accounts, filter by bio keywords and follower count, and export targeted lists. Uses: follower_explorer, get-user-info.

### Creator & Influencer Tools

- **Creator CRM**: Track relationships with brands, log interactions, and surface engagement stats per partnership. Uses: post_extractor, mention_extractor, lookup-tweet.
- **Sponsorship proof dashboard**: Show brands real engagement metrics on sponsored posts: impressions, likes, retweets, quotes, bookmarks. Uses: lookup-tweet, post_extractor.
- **Community health score**: Measure reply rates, unique repliers, and sentiment in a creator's community over time. Uses: reply_extractor, mention_extractor, post_extractor.
- **Reply management app**: Surface all replies to a creator's recent posts, sorted by engagement, for efficient community interaction. Uses: reply_extractor, lookup-tweet.
- **Thread analytics**: Extract full threads and measure per-tweet drop-off in engagement to optimize thread structure. Uses: thread_extractor, lookup-tweet.
- **Content repurposing pipeline**: Extract a creator's top-performing posts, rank by engagement, and feed into an AI repurposing workflow. Uses: post_extractor, lookup-tweet.
- **Collaboration finder**: Find creators in a niche by searching tweets, then rank by engagement rate and audience size. Uses: search-tweets, get-user-info, post_extractor.

### Giveaway & Contest Platforms

- **White-label giveaway SaaS**: Offer brands a self-service platform to run transparent, auditable giveaway draws on their tweets. Uses: run-draw, get-draw, list-draws.
- **Agency contest manager**: Run and manage giveaway draws for multiple brand clients from a single dashboard. Uses: run-draw, get-draw, export draws.
- **Giveaway compliance tool**: Enforce contest rules (must follow, must retweet, account age, min followers) and produce audit trails. Uses: run-draw with filters, get-draw.
- **Giveaway analytics**: Track draw history, entry counts, winner demographics, and engagement lift from contests over time. Uses: list-draws, get-draw, get-user-info.
- **Affiliate giveaway network**: Let affiliates run giveaways on behalf of brands, track entries and winners per affiliate. Uses: run-draw, get-draw.
- **Recurring giveaway scheduler**: Automate weekly/monthly giveaways: create draw, pick winners, notify via webhook. Uses: run-draw, webhooks.

### AI Agent Products

- **Social listening agent**: Autonomous agent that monitors keywords, summarizes daily activity, and answers natural language questions about trends. Uses: search-tweets, monitors, events, MCP server.
- **Competitor intelligence agent**: AI agent that tracks competitor accounts, detects strategy changes, and produces weekly briefings. Uses: monitors, post_extractor, follower_explorer, MCP server.
- **Customer support escalation bot**: Monitor brand mentions, detect complaints using NLP, and auto-escalate to support channels. Uses: monitors (tweet.reply, tweet.quote), mention_extractor, webhooks.
- **Content curation agent**: AI agent that searches tweets by topic, scores relevance, and publishes curated digests to Slack, email, or a blog. Uses: search-tweets, lookup-tweet, MCP server.
- **Deal and opportunity detector**: Search for purchase-intent tweets ("looking for", "need a", "recommend a"), score leads, and route to sales. Uses: search-tweets, get-user-info.
- **PR crisis early warning agent**: Monitor brand mentions and follower loss events, alert the team when negative signals cross a threshold. Uses: monitors (follower.lost, tweet.reply), mention_extractor, webhooks.
- **Recruiter sourcing agent**: Search for developers tweeting about specific technologies, enrich profiles, and build candidate shortlists. Uses: search-tweets, get-user-info, follower_explorer.
- **Investment signal agent**: Monitor company accounts for product launches, partnerships, and leadership changes. Uses: monitors, post_extractor, search-tweets, MCP server.

### Community & Moderation

- **Community analytics dashboard**: Extract community members, moderators, and posts, then visualize engagement and growth. Uses: community_extractor, community_moderator_explorer, community_post_extractor.
- **Community search tool**: Search across community posts to find discussions on specific topics. Uses: community_search.
- **Member engagement scoring**: Score community members by post frequency, reply count, and follower influence. Uses: community_extractor, post_extractor, get-user-info.
- **Community growth tracker**: Track member count over time by periodically extracting the member list and computing deltas. Uses: community_extractor.
- **List management tool**: Extract list members, posts, and followers to analyze curated Twitter lists. Uses: list_member_extractor, list_post_extractor, list_follower_explorer.
- **Space participant directory**: Extract Space participants with profile data for post-event follow-ups and networking. Uses: space_explorer, get-user-info.

### Mobile Apps

- **Real-time tweet alert app**: Push notifications when monitored accounts tweet, reply, quote, or retweet. Uses: monitors, webhooks, events.
- **Follower change tracker**: iOS/Android app that charts follower gains and losses over time with daily summaries. Uses: monitors (follower.gained, follower.lost), events.
- **Engagement tracker widget**: Home screen widget showing live engagement stats for your latest tweets. Uses: post_extractor, lookup-tweet.
- **X analytics for mobile**: Full analytics app: audience breakdown, post performance, growth trends, competitor comparison. Uses: follower_explorer, post_extractor, lookup-tweet, get-user-info.
- **Giveaway entry companion**: App that shows active giveaways, entry requirements, and draw results. Uses: list-draws, get-draw.
- **Thread reader app**: Extract and display full tweet threads in a clean reading format. Uses: thread_extractor.
- **Mutual follow checker**: Check mutual follow status between any two accounts instantly. Uses: check-follow.
- **Account watchlist**: Track multiple accounts with customizable alerts per event type. Uses: monitors, events, webhooks.

### Developer Tools & Integrations

- **Slack bot for tweet alerts**: Forward monitored account activity to Slack channels in real time. Uses: monitors, webhooks.
- **Discord bot for tweet alerts**: Same as Slack but for Discord servers. Uses: monitors, webhooks.
- **Zapier/Make/n8n integration**: Webhook-triggered automations: new tweet triggers email, Notion entry, CRM update, etc. Uses: webhooks.
- **CRM enrichment plugin**: Enrich HubSpot, Salesforce, or Pipedrive contacts with X profile data. Uses: get-user-info, check-follow.
- **Notion/Airtable sync**: Sync extraction results, draw winners, or event data into Notion databases or Airtable bases. Uses: extractions, draws, events.
- **Webhook relay service**: Fan out Xquik webhook events to multiple downstream services with transformation and filtering. Uses: webhooks.
- **CLI tool for X data**: Command-line tool for quick lookups, extractions, and draws without leaving the terminal. Uses: all endpoints.
- **GitHub Actions integration**: Trigger extraction or draw jobs from CI/CD pipelines, post results as PR comments. Uses: extractions, draws.

### Data & Research

- **Academic research pipeline**: Bulk extract tweets, replies, and user data for social science research with structured CSV/XLSX export. Uses: extractions, export.
- **Journalist source tracker**: Monitor key accounts and surface breaking news, statements, and deleted tweet patterns. Uses: monitors, events, post_extractor.
- **Political campaign monitor**: Track candidate accounts, measure follower growth, compare engagement, and detect coordinated activity. Uses: monitors, follower_explorer, post_extractor, mention_extractor.
- **Public opinion polling**: Search tweets about policy topics, categorize positions, and produce sentiment breakdowns. Uses: search-tweets.
- **Market research from tweets**: Extract conversations about products/industries, identify pain points, and generate market reports. Uses: search-tweets, reply_extractor.
- **Misinformation tracker**: Monitor how specific claims spread by tracking retweets, quotes, and reply chains. Uses: repost_extractor, quote_extractor, reply_extractor, thread_extractor.
- **Article extraction pipeline**: Pull article content linked in tweets for archival or analysis. Uses: article_extractor.

### E-commerce & Sales

- **Social proof aggregator**: Collect positive tweets and reviews about a product, display on a storefront as testimonials. Uses: search-tweets, mention_extractor.
- **Customer feedback scraper**: Extract all replies and mentions of a brand, categorize by feature requests, bugs, and praise. Uses: mention_extractor, reply_extractor.
- **Purchase intent detector**: Search for tweets expressing buying intent ("just bought", "looking to buy"), route to sales or retargeting. Uses: search-tweets, get-user-info.
- **Product launch monitor**: Track competitor product accounts for launch announcements and measure initial reception. Uses: monitors, post_extractor, reply_extractor.
- **Review mining tool**: Extract threaded conversations about products and summarize pros/cons using AI. Uses: search-tweets, thread_extractor, reply_extractor.
- **Affiliate link tracker**: Search for tweets containing affiliate URLs, measure engagement, and identify top affiliate promoters. Uses: search-tweets, get-user-info.

### Finance & Crypto

- **Crypto sentiment tracker**: Monitor crypto project accounts and keyword searches for sentiment shifts that may signal price movement. Uses: monitors, search-tweets, mention_extractor.
- **Whale watcher**: Track high-profile crypto accounts for announcements and measure follower/engagement impact. Uses: monitors, post_extractor, lookup-tweet.
- **Earnings reaction analyzer**: Monitor company accounts around earnings dates, capture real-time tweet reactions, and score sentiment. Uses: monitors, search-tweets, reply_extractor.
- **VC deal flow scanner**: Search for founder tweets about fundraising, product launches, and hiring to surface investment opportunities. Uses: search-tweets, get-user-info.
- **Token launch monitor**: Track new crypto project accounts, measure community growth velocity, and flag suspicious follower patterns. Uses: monitors (follower.gained), follower_explorer, verified_follower_explorer.
